title: Hong Kong Protester Throws Fire Bomb at MTR Station Elevator
text:
Thousands of anti-government protesters returned to Hong Kong’s streets on Sunday, October 6, in defiance of an emergency law banning activists from wearing masks.

Sunday’s rally marked the third consecutive day of protests over the mask ban, which came into force late on Friday.

This footage shows a protester throwing an accelerant on Nathan Road.

Mass protests in Hong Kong started in March over a now-shelved extradition bill that would have allowed people to be sent to mainland China for trial. The protests have broadened, with hundreds of thousands participating in multiple rallies. Credit: Campus TV HKUSU via Storyful
description: Thousands of anti-government protesters returned to Hong Kong’s streets on Sunday, October 6, in defiance of an emergency law banning activists from wearing masks. Sunday’s rally marked the third consecutive day of protests over the mask ban, which came into force late on Friday. This footage shows a protester throwing an accelerant on Nathan Road. Mass protests in Hong Kong started in March over a now-shelved extradition bill that would have allowed people to be sent to mainland China for trial. The protests have broadened, with hundreds of thousands participating in multiple rallies. Credit: Campus TV HKUSU via Storyful
